identificationModule.briefTitle: Tenecteplase Thrombolytic Therapy for Acute Ischemic Stroke in China
identificationModule.officialTitle: Tenecteplase Thrombolytic Therapy for Acute Ischemic Stroke in China a Real-world, Multicenter, Retrospective, Controlled Study

collaborators.name: Keshiketeng Banner Traditional Chinese Medicine Mongolian Medicine Hospitalorem Ipsum
The First Affiliated Hospital of Ningbo University
Shenyang Fushun general hospital of mining bureau

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The objective of the study is to investigate the effectiveness and safety of rhTNK-tPA in acute ischemic stroke patients within 4.5 hours of symptom onset in a real-world clinical setting.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Recombinant human tenecteplase tissue-type plasminogen activator (rhTNK-tPA) has the logistic advantage of a single bolus infusion over recombinant tissue plasminogen activator (rt-PA) which needs a 1-hour infusion. The non-inferiority of rhTNK-tPA compared to rt-PA was proved by two recent randomized controlled clinical trials but the evidence is lacking regarding the real-world effectiveness and safety of rhTNK-tPA.

This is a multi-center, observational, retrospective study that enrolled acute ischemic stroke patients treated with rhTNK-tPA thrombolysis in China.

armGroups.label: Tenecteplase
armGroups.description: acute ischemic stroke patients who receive intravenous thrombolysis with tenecteplase

armGroups.label: alteplase
armGroups.description: acute ischemic stroke patients who receive intravenous thrombolysis with alteplase

primaryOutcomes.measure: Rate of patients with symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage within 36 hours
primaryOutcomes.description: Clinical deterioration or neurological decline causing an increase in NIHSS score of ≥4 points due to intracranial hemorrhage confirmed by brain imaging

secondaryOutcomes.description: modified Rankin Scale score measures degree of disability/dependence after a stroke. Patients are graded on the scale of 0-6, with higher scores indicating worse functional outcome. 0 means no symptoms, 6 means death.

a shift analysis of the distribution of modified Rankin Scale score which measures degree of disability/dependence after a stroke. Patients are graded on the scale of 0-6, with higher scores indicating worse functional outcome. 0 means no symptoms, 6 means death.

modified Rankin Scale score measures degree of disability/dependence after a stroke. Patients are graded on the scale of 0-6, with higher scores indicating worse functional outcome. 0 means no symptoms, 6 means death.
The NIH Stroke Scale/Score (NIHSS) quantifies stroke severity based on weighted evaluation findings. Scores range from 0 to 42, with higher scores indicating greater severity.
The NIH Stroke Scale/Score (NIHSS) quantifies stroke severity based on weighted evaluation findings. Scores range from 0 to 42, with higher scores indicating greater severity.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Rate of patients with any systematic bleeding
secondaryOutcomes.description: Rate of patients with any systematic bleeding requiring blood infusion during hospital stay reflecting short term safety outcome

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Rate of patients with 90 days mortality
secondaryOutcomes.description: Rate of patients with all-cause mortality within 90 days reflecting safety outcome

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Rate of patients with any intracranial hemorrhage
secondaryOutcomes.description: Rate of patients with any intracranial hemorrhage without significant neurological deterioration on the brain imaging reflecting short term safety outcome

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* all acute ischaemic stroke patients who met eligibility for thrombolysis with intravenous alteplase or TNK and presenting within 4·5 hours of symptom onset.

Exclusion Criteria:

* variables with a missing rate \> 40%
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: acute ischemic stroke patients treated with rhTNK-tPA or rt-PA in China.
